references.paper_title: Consistency of random forests and other averaging classifiers
references.reason: This paper establishes the consistency of random forests, a crucial result for understanding the theoretical properties of this widely used algorithm and is directly relevant to the theoretical analysis in the current paper.

references.paper_title: A Probabilistic Theory of Pattern Recognition
references.reason: This book provides a comprehensive overview of the probabilistic theory of pattern recognition, which is foundational to the study of non-parametric classification methods and is essential for the theoretical results in this paper.

references.paper_title: A Distribution-Free Theory of Nonparametric Regression
references.reason: This book offers a comprehensive theoretical framework for nonparametric regression, which is closely related to nonparametric classification, and is critical for the theoretical analysis of convergence rates in this paper.
